VIA CERTIFIED MAIL/RETURN RECEIPT REQUESTED

PERSONAL & CONFIDENTIAL

${contact_name}

${policy.current.issue_company}

${claimant.primary_address}

${claimant.state}

Re:

Insured:

[insert]

 

Policy No.:

[insert]

 

Reference No:

[insert]

 

Matter:

[insert]

Dear [insert]:

On behalf of NORCAL Mutual Insurance Company (“NORCAL”), please allow this letter to follow up on our prior correspondence to [insert name of recipient(s)], dated [Month Date, Year], acknowledging receipt of [insert description of what we received] in connection with the above-referenced matter (“the [insert] Matter/Action”).]  [OR, if this correspondence is the first correspondence that’s being issued to the insured since the matter was first submitted to the company, then say:  On behalf of NORCAL Mutual Insurance Company (“NORCAL”), please allow this correspondence to confirm that on [Month Date, Year], NORCAL received notice of [insert description of what we received] in connection with the above-referenced matter (the “[insert] Matter/Action”).]  We regret to inform you that, for the reasons discussed below, NORCAL has determined that coverage is unavailable for the [insert name of the matter] under the above-referenced policy (the “Policy”).  [If the letter is addressed to someone other than the insured, then add this sentence to the end of this paragraph:  To the extent you are not the representative of [insert name of the insured] for communications regarding insurance coverage for the [insert name of the matter], please let us know to whom we should direct correspondence regarding coverage as soon as possible.]

We summarize below the allegations reflected in the [insert] so that you will understand the context of NORCAL’s coverage position, but you should refer to the [insert] itself for the complete allegations therein.  Please appreciate that NORCAL is not expressing any view on the truth of such allegations.  NORCAL invites you to provide us with any information you believe may be relevant to the coverage issues discussed below.  This letter should be read in conjunction with the Policy.

The Facts

[If we received a copy of a complaint, then you can say:  On [Month Date, Year], [list all of the plaintiffs by name] filed a [insert] against [list all of the defendants, including non-insureds].  [OR, if we received a Notice of Intent/Demand letter/ whatever else that preceded the complaint along with a complaint, describe that first.  If there’s a letter, then start by explaining who sent it (if applicable, explain if someone sent it on someone else’s behalf), the date of the letter, to whom it was issued, and then summarize what it says.]

[Insert your summary of the asserted allegations.  This may take up several paragraphs, but that’s okay.  Try to cover every category of allegations that are asserted.  For example, if the complaint has 20 sentences that all basically say that the insured acted with intent to harm the claimant, then you don’t need to summarize every sentence that alleges intent to harm; a couple sentences summarizing the allegation will suffice.  On the other hand, if there’s an allegation that the insured fudged the medical record and acted with intent to harm, then be sure that your summary notes both allegations.]

[If you are summarizing a complaint, then include this at the end of your summary:  Based on the foregoing allegations, the [Complaint/FAC/etc.] asserts causes of action against the Defendants for: (1) --; (2) --; ….  [list all of the causes of action, but be careful to note if certain COA’s are only brought against certain defendants].  The Plaintiffs seek to recover [list all of the relief that the plaintiffs seek, regardless of whether you think it’s covered or not].]

[If we received additional information or materials (i.e., responses to demand letters, facts we learned through talking with the insured or defense counsel, etc.), be sure to include that in chronological order IF it’s important to the procedural status of what’s going on in the claim, important to the coverage analysis, or for some other pertinent reason.  So, for example, if we received a copy of the Answer to the Complaint, we won’t need to summarize that unless there’s something in the Answer that affects the coverage analysis or some other important factor.]

The Policy

Subject to its terms and conditions, NORCAL issued [insert the name of the policy (i.e., Medical Professional Liability Insurance Policy)] No. [insert number] to [insert Named Insured] for the [insert the policy period in Month Date, Year format] Policy Period [if applicable, insert: , with a Retroactive Date of May 27, 2016].  The Policy is written on a claims-made and reported basis and provides coverage in the amount of [insert amount] per [insert the event- Claim, Administrative Proceeding, etc.] and [insert amount] in the aggregate for each Policy Period under Coverage [insert], which is the only potentially applicable Coverage Part of the Policy.  [If there has been any erosion of the applicable limit of liability or the aggregate limit of liability, note that here.  Also, if there is a deductible, you should note that in this section, as well, and explain whether the deductible applies to defense costs and/or indemnity.  Finally, if the claim involves more than one insured, note whether the limits are shared, separate, etc.  Depending on all of the info being relayed, you may need to break your discussion down into several paragraphs.]

[If you are analyzing coverage for an insured that is not the Named Insured, then you’ll need to explain how the individual/entity qualifies as an insured and what limits are available to that individual/entity and what, if any, limitations to coverage there are.  Here is a sample:

Subject to its terms and conditions, NORCAL issued Medical Professional Liability Insurance Policy number 123 to ABC Co. for the October 31, 2016 to October 31, 2017 Policy Period.[fn that says “except for headings….”]  Pursuant to Endorsement Sequence Number 4, you, Jane Doe, MD, were added as an Insured to the Policy, but only while acting within the course and scope of your duties for ABC Co.  The Policy is written on a claims made and reported basis and provides a separate limit of liability of $50,000 each Administrative Proceeding or Employment-Related Civil Action and $150,000 in the aggregate under Coverage B, which is the only potentially applicable Coverage Part of the Policy.[fn that explains why the other coverage parts aren’t triggered]]

WHO IS AN INSURED

[This section will not always be necessary.  It will be necessary if there are multiple defendants or claims being asserted against multiple individuals/entities and not everyone is an insured.  Here is a sample:

As noted above, ABC Co. and Jane Doe are Insureds under the Policy.  In contrast, DEF Co. and John Doe do not appear to be Insureds under the Policy.  Accordingly, the Policy does not afford coverage for DEF Co. or John Doe with respect to the Example Action.  If you disagree with our understanding in this regard, please notify us immediately and provide us with any relevant documentation, at which time we would be pleased to review NORCAL’s position.

Here’s another sample:

As noted above, ABC Co. was added as an Insured to Coverage Part A pursuant to Endorsement Sequence Number 1, and Jan Doe, John Doe, and Jimmy Doe were added as Insureds to Coverage Parts A and C pursuant to Endorsement Number 2.

In addition, DEF Co. and Jack Doe are not Named Insureds under the Policy, nor were they added as Insureds via an Endorsement to the Policy.  Accordingly, the Policy does not afford coverage for DEF Co. and Jack Doe with respect to the Sample Action.  If you disagree with our understanding in this regard, please notify us immediately and provide us with any relevant documentation, at which time we would be pleased to review NORCAL’s position.]

Coverage Disclaimer

[Always start by reciting the pertinent parts of the applicable coverage part’s insuring agreement and explaining whether the insuring agreement is triggered.]

Under the insuring agreement provided in Coverage [insert], the Policy provides the following, in relevant part:

[Sample:

We will pay Damages, up to the applicable limits of coverage for Medical Professional Liability Insurance, on behalf of an Insured because of a Medical Incident that takes place within the Coverage Territory on or after the Insured’s Retroactive Date . . . and that results in a Claim first made against that Insured, and first reported to Us, during the Policy Period.  . . . .]

[citation].  [Now, recite the pertinent parts of the relevant terms’ definitions, including citations to where the definition can be found in the policy.  Then explain whether the insuring agreement is/isn’t triggered and reserve rights, where appropriate.  For example, if you are denying based on the Claim being made before the Policy Period, you should also include a reservation regarding whether the insured’s alleged conduct constitutes a Professional Health Care Service, if the allegations indicate that some of the acts/omissions don’t or may not constitute a Professional Health Care Service.  This discussion may take more than one paragraph.]

[If you have other policy terms or exclusions, which also operate to preclude coverage or which you want to say could preclude coverage, then say this: In addition to the foregoing, we would like to draw your attention to [insert citation], which provides, in relevant part: 

[Insert the applicable policy provision in a block quote if it’s longer than 4 lines long]

Explain how the cited policy exclusion/provision relates to the facts of this claim and whether it’s an additional reason why coverage is unavailable or if we are reserving rights to assert it as an additional denial point at a later time.  For example, if I cite the prior knowledge exclusion, then I would follow the citation with an explanation of whether the exclusion is an additional denial point or a reservation.  Here’s a sample:

As discussed above, because you responded to Claimant’s Demand Letter on October 25, 2106, it appears that you received the Claimant’s Demand Letter and knew about the Claimant’s allegations and charges against you before the Policy incepted on October 31, 2016.  Accordingly, while coverage under the Policy is unavailable for the Example Matter, in the first instance, because it does not implicate Coverage A’s insuring agreement (as discussed above), coverage would also be unavailable for the Example Matter pursuant to this exclusion.]

DEFENSE

Pursuant to [insert citation], “[w]e shall have the right and duty to defend any claim or suit seeking damages to which this insurance applies.”  As explained above, however, the Policy does not afford coverage for the [insert the name of the matter].  Accordingly, NORCAL will not be defending [insert the name of the insured] in the [insert the name of the matter].  As stated in our [insert date] letter, we initially referred this matter to [insert name of attorney] of [insert the name of the attorney’s firm] to protect [the name of the insured’s] interests while NORCAL undertook its coverage analysis of this matter.  Because NORCAL has determined that coverage is unavailable for the [insert the name of the matter], NORCAL will be instructing [Mr./Ms. Attorney] to cease working on this matter effective [insert date].  Of course, [insert name of the insured] is free to retain [Mr./Ms. Attorney], at [its/his/her/your] own expense, to defend [it/his/her/you] against the [insert name of the matter].

*  *  *

Please appreciate that NORCAL’s coverage position is based on the information currently available to it.  If you believe that NORCAL has misunderstood any aspect of this matter, please let us know and provide us with any relevant information, at which time NORCAL would be pleased to review its position.  Please note further that NORCAL fully reserves all of its rights under the Policy and applicable law, that the above discussion is not intended to be exhaustive or exclusive, and that there may be other terms and conditions of the Policy which, although not specifically mentioned in this letter, may apply to this matter.  NORCAL reserves the right to assert any additional Policy term or condition that might be applicable, or as circumstances may warrant as additional information becomes available.  NORCAL’s actions in investigating, evaluating, and/or monitoring this matter should not be construed as a waiver, estoppel, or other relinquishment of NORCAL’s rights to limit or deny coverage, nor as any admission of any obligation under the Policy.

This matter should also be tendered to any other insurance or source of indemnification available to you.  Should you have any questions or concerns, please feel free to contact me at [insert phone number] or [insert email].

Sincerely,

 

 

[Insert your name]

Claims Specialist

 

 

cc: [if applicable]
